ground_truth: Annie calculates a moment while Lindsey is back watching the TV Horror-thon and her eyes light up. Annie and Lindsey come out of the Wallace house, with Lindsey carrying a bowl of popcorn and Annie having a coat over her negligee. They walk down the street to the Doyles, the wind blowing strong and whipping the negligee around Annie's legs as they make their way down the street. The SHAPE steps into the glow of the streetlight and watches them. Tommy runs to answer it and opens the door, where Annie and Lindsey stand. Lindsey sees the TV and runs into the living room, taking off her coat, sitting in front of the TV, and eating her popcorn. She glances at Annie's coat as Laurie glances at Lindsey. Before Laurie can say anything else, Annie rushes out the door. Laurie closes the door and looks in at Tommy and Lindsey engrossed in the Horror-thon. Annie hurries across the backyard and steps into the garage, walks to her car, tries the door, then quickly turns and walks out of the garage. Annie wanders through the empty house looking for her purse, finds it in the front room, takes out her brush and lipstick, and stands in front of the mirror primping. She glances up at her image in the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy hides, preparing to jump out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey gets up from the couch to search for Tommy and turns around looking for him. For a moment, he glances out the window and sees the figure of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard. Tommy SCREAMS and jumps out from the curtain, scaring Lindsey, who also SCREAMS and begins crying. Laurie rushes in from the kitchen, finding the children in tears. Tommy points out the window, and Laurie bends down to comfort her. Tommy turns away from Laurie and Lindsey and walks over to the couch in front of the TV set, and almost instantly, Lindsey stops crying and follows him, sitting up next to Tommy and hugging him. Laurie shakes her head and walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark, whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the hedge where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly, there are noises from the street, and three boys, Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house, staring fearfully at the dark, tomb-like structure. Loomis parts the hedge in front of him and stares. For a moment, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch, while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house, unsure whether he should interfere or just watch.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Annie computes an instant while Lindsey is back observing the TV Horror-thon and her eyes illuminate. Annie and Lindsey emerge from the Wallace residence, with Lindsey holding a bowl of popcorn and Annie having a cloak over her negligee. They stroll down the avenue to the Doyles, the breeze blowing robust and thrashing the negligee around Annie's legs as they make their way down the avenue. The SHAPE steps into the radiance of the streetlight and observes them. Tommy dashes to respond to it and opens the portal, where Annie and Lindsey stand. Lindsey perceives the TV and dashes into the living chamber, removing her cloak, sitting in front of the TV, and consuming her popcorn. She glances at Annie's cloak as Laurie glances at Lindsey. Before Laurie can utter anything else, Annie rushes out the portal. Laurie shuts the portal and looks in at Tommy and Lindsey absorbed in the Horror-thon. Annie hastens across the yard and steps into the garage, ambles to her vehicle, tries the portal, then swiftly turns and ambles out of the garage. Annie roams through the vacant house seeking her handbag, finds it in the front room, takes out her comb and lipstick, and stands in front of the mirror grooming. She glances up at her reflection in the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy conceals, preparing to leap out and frighten Lindsey. Lindsey rises from the sofa to search for Tommy and revolves around seeking him. For an instant, he glances out the window and sees the silhouette of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's yard. Tommy SHRIEKS and leaps out from the drapery, startling Lindsey, who also SHRIEKS and begins weeping. Laurie dashes in from the kitchen, discovering the youngsters in tears. Tommy gestures toward the window, and Laurie bends down to console her. Tommy turns away from Laurie and Lindsey and ambles over to the sofa in front of the TV set, and almost instantly, Lindsey halts weeping and follows him, sitting up next to Tommy and embracing him. Laurie shakes her head and ambles back into the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house appears ominous and threatening silhouetted against the dark, whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the shrub where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly, there are sounds from the avenue, and three boys, Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, sneak up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house, gazing fearfully at the dark, tomb-like structure. Loomis parts the shrub in front of him and gazes. For an instant, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly advances through the front gate up toward the porch, while Loomis observes the young boy walk toward the house, unsure whether he should intervene or just watch.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A moment is calculated by Annie while Lindsey is back watching the TV Horror-thon, and her eyes light up. The Wallace house is exited by Annie and Lindsey, with a bowl of popcorn carried by Lindsey and a coat over her negligee worn by Annie. The street is walked down by them to the Doyles, with the wind blowing strong and whipping the negligee around Annie's legs as the street is traversed. The glow of the streetlight is stepped into by the SHAPE, who watches them. The door is run to and opened by Tommy, where Annie and Lindsey stand. The TV is seen by Lindsey, who runs into the living room, takes off her coat, sits in front of the TV, and eats her popcorn. Annie's coat is glanced at by her as Laurie glances at Lindsey. Before anything else can be said by Laurie, the door is rushed out by Annie. The door is closed by Laurie, who looks in at Tommy and Lindsey engrossed in the Horror-thon. The backyard is hurried across by Annie, who steps into the garage, walks to her car, tries the door, then quickly turns and walks out of the garage. The empty house is wandered through by Annie looking for her purse, which is found in the front room. A brush and lipstick are taken out by her, and she stands in front of the mirror primping. Her image in the mirror is glanced up at by her. Meanwhile, Tommy hides and prepares to jump out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey gets up from the couch to search for Tommy and turns around looking for him. For a moment, the window is glanced out by him, and the figure of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard is seen. Tommy SCREAMS and jumps out from the curtain, scaring Lindsey, who SCREAMS and begins crying. Laurie rushes in from the kitchen, finding the children in tears. Tommy points out the window, and Laurie bends down to comfort her. Laurie is turned away from by Tommy, who walks over to the couch in front of the TV set, and almost instantly, Lindsey stops crying and follows him, sitting up next to Tommy and hugging him. Her head is shaken by Laurie, who walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark, whishing trees. The hedge is tracked behind by the camera where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly, noises are heard from the street, and three boys, Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house, staring fearfully at the dark, tomb-like structure. The hedge in front of him is parted by Loomis, who stares. For a moment, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch, while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house, unsure whether he should interfere or just watch.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Annie calculates time as Lindsey watches TV during a Horror-thon, eyes lighting up. Annie and Lindsey leave the Wallace house; Lindsey has popcorn while Annie wears a coat over her negligee. They head to the Doyles, wind whipping the negligee around Annie's legs. The SHAPE appears under the streetlight, observing. Tommy answers the door for Annie and Lindsey. Lindsey rushes to the TV, discarding her coat and eating popcorn. Annie promptly exits while Laurie notices Lindsey. Laurie watches Tommy and Lindsey engrossed in TV. Annie darts to the garage, checks her car, then retrieves her purse from the house, primping in the mirror. Tommy plans to scare Lindsey, but sees a MAN carrying a BODY. Screaming, Tommy jumps out, startling Lindsey. Laurie comforts the crying children, who soon return to watching TV. The spooky Myers house stands against dark trees. Loomis waits behind a hedge. Keith, Richie, and Lonnie approach, eyeing the ominous house. Lonnie hesitantly enters the gate as Loomis watches, unsure whether to act.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Annie calculates as Lindsey watches the TV Horror-thon. They leave the Wallace house, Lindsey with popcorn and Annie in a coat over her negligee. As they walk to the Doyles, the wind whips Annie's negligee. The SHAPE appears under the streetlight. Tommy opens the door for them. Lindsey runs to the TV, eating popcorn, while Annie rushes out. Laurie watches Tommy and Lindsey engrossed in the Horror-thon. Annie enters the garage, checks her car, then searches the house for her purse, primping in front of a mirror. Tommy hides to scare Lindsey, who gets up searching. He sees a MAN carrying a BODY across the yard, screams, and scares Lindsey. Laurie comforts them, then Tommy and Lindsey return to the TV. Laurie returns to the kitchen. The Myers house looms ominously. Loomis watches as three boys approach. Lonnie hesitates but moves toward the house while Loomis debates intervening.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Annie takes a moment to calculate her next move while Lindsey is comfortably settled in, deeply engrossed in watching the TV Horror-thon, her eyes lighting up with excitement and anticipation. Annie and Lindsey then emerge from the familiar confines of the Wallace house. Lindsey is carefully balancing a large bowl brimming with popcorn, while Annie is draped in a coat that covers her delicate negligee. As they venture down the dimly lit street toward the Doyles' house, the night wind gusts intensely, catching hold of Annie's negligee and swirling it around her legs as they continue down the path. Meanwhile, the SHAPE ominously steps into the glow cast by the streetlight, silently observing them from a distance. 

Tommy, eager and quick to respond, runs to answer the doorbell and promptly opens the door to reveal Annie and Lindsey standing there. Lindsey, spotting the TV inside, eagerly darts into the living room, shedding her coat as she makes herself comfortable. She promptly sits in front of the television, munching happily on her popcorn. Her gaze momentarily falls upon Annie's coat, just as Laurie glances at Lindsey. However, before Laurie can utter another word, Annie swiftly rushes back out through the door. Laurie closes the door, then turns her attention back to Tommy and Lindsey, who are thoroughly absorbed in the Horror-thon playing on the screen.

Annie hurriedly crosses the backyard, making her way into the garage. She approaches her car, attempts to open the car door, and then, just as quickly, turns to exit the garage. Wandering through the empty, quiet house, Annie searches for her misplaced purse. She eventually finds it in the front room. She retrieves her brush and lipstick from the purse and stands poised in front of the mirror, primping with care. As she tends to her appearance, she momentarily glances up, catching her own reflection in the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy is playfully hiding, ready to jump out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey, curious and searching for Tommy, rises from the couch and casts her gaze around the room, seeking him out. Her glance drifts to the window, and she catches sight of the shadowy figure of a MAN outside, seemingly carrying a BODY across the Wallace's dimly lit backyard. 

Tommy then SCREAMS, leaping out from behind the curtain and startling Lindsey, who also SCREAMS in fright and begins to cry. Laurie hurries in from the kitchen, discovering the children in tears and distress. Tommy points towards the window, and Laurie bends down, wrapping her arms around Lindsey to comfort her. As Tommy turns away from Laurie’s comforting presence, he moves back to the couch in front of the TV set. Almost as if by magic, Lindsey immediately ceases crying, follows Tommy, and sits beside him, hugging him tightly. Laurie, shaking her head, exits the room and returns to the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house looms ominously, its silhouette stark against the backdrop of dark, rustling trees. The camera follows from behind the hedge where Loomis is sitting in wait. Suddenly, the sounds of activity drift from the street, where three young boys, Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, approach the edge of the sidewalk, gazing fearfully at the foreboding, tomb-like structure of the old house. Loomis peers through the hedge in front of him, observing the scene. For a moment, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly approaches, moving through the front gate and up toward the porch. Loomis watches the young boy's progress, contemplating whether he should intervene or simply continue to watch.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Annie pauses for a brief moment to carefully calculate what her next move should be, while Lindsey sits comfortably situated, deeply engrossed in the excitement and anticipation of watching the TV Horror-thon. Her eyes glimmer with delight as she remains fixated on the screen. Soon after, Annie and Lindsey make their way out of the familiar and cozy confines of the Wallace house. Lindsey is seen carefully balancing a generously filled large bowl brimming with popcorn, while Annie is elegantly draped in a coat that gracefully covers her delicate negligee. The duo venture down the dimly lit street toward the Doyles' house, and the night wind gusts forcefully, catching Annie's negligee and swirling it around her legs as they continue their path forward. In the meantime, the chilling SHAPE ominously steps into the pool of light cast by the streetlight, silently observing them from a distance.

Tommy, eager and quick to spring into action, runs to respond to the sound of the doorbell and promptly opens the door, revealing Annie and Lindsey standing there. Lindsey, her eyes instantly locking onto the TV inside, eagerly darts toward the living room. She sheds her coat quickly and makes herself comfortable in front of the television, munching contentedly on her popcorn. Her gaze momentarily falls upon Annie's coat, just as Laurie shifts her glance toward Lindsey. However, before Laurie can utter a single word of inquiry, Annie swiftly moves back out through the door. Laurie subsequently closes the door, then redirects her focus toward Tommy and Lindsey, who are completely engrossed in the Horror-thon playing on the screen.

Annie hurriedly crosses the backyard, making her way toward the garage. She approaches her car, attempts to open the door, and then, just as swiftly, turns to exit the garage once again. She wanders through the quiet, empty house, searching for her misplaced purse. Eventually, she locates it in the front room. She retrieves both her brush and lipstick from the purse and stands poised in front of the mirror, primping with meticulous care. As she attends to her appearance, she momentarily glances upward, catching sight of her own reflection in the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy is playfully hiding, ready to leap out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey, curious and intent on finding Tommy, rises from the couch, casting her gaze throughout the room in search of him. Her glance inadvertently drifts to the window, where she catches sight of the shadowy figure of a MAN outside, appearing to carry a BODY across the dimly lit backyard of the Wallace house.

Then, all of a sudden, Tommy releases a SCREAM, leaping out from behind the curtain and startling Lindsey, who also SCREAMS in fright and begins to cry. Laurie quickly hurries in from the kitchen, discovering the children in tears and distress. Tommy points insistently toward the window, and Laurie bends down, wrapping her arms around Lindsey to offer comfort. As Tommy turns away from Laurie’s comforting presence, he moves back toward the couch positioned in front of the TV set. Almost as if by magic, Lindsey immediately ceases her crying, follows Tommy, and sits closely beside him, hugging him tightly. Laurie, shaking her head at the scene, exits the room and returns to the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house looms ominously, its silhouette stark against the backdrop of dark, rustling trees. The camera follows from behind the hedge where Loomis is sitting, attentively waiting. Suddenly, the sounds of activity drift from the street, where three young boys, named Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, approach the edge of the sidewalk, gazing fearfully at the foreboding, tomb-like structure of the old house. Loomis peers through the hedge in front of him, observing the unfolding scene. For a brief moment, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly inches forward, moving through the front gate and up toward the porch. Loomis watches the young boy's progress, contemplating whether he should intervene at this point or simply continue to watch the scene unfold.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Annie stands still for a brief moment, mentally calculating a plan while observing Lindsey, who is captivated by the TV Horror-thon, causing a spark of realization to light up in Annie's eyes. Decisively, Annie and Lindsey exit the Wallace house, with Lindsey carefully balancing a bowl of popcorn in her hands while Annie drapes a coat over her negligee to ward off the evening chill. Together, they make their way down the street, the gusty wind swirling around them and mischievously whipping Annie's negligee against her legs, as they proceed toward the Doyles' residence. Unbeknownst to them, the SHAPE silently emerges into the illumination of a streetlight, standing still as it observes their journey. Inside, Tommy eagerly dashes to the door, throws it open, and finds Annie and Lindsey standing expectantly. Lindsey's eyes immediately catch sight of the TV, prompting her to sprint into the living room, shrugging off her coat, before settling in front of the flickering screen and munching on her popcorn. Her gaze briefly flickers over to Annie's coat as Laurie, standing nearby, fleetingly exchanges a look with Lindsey. Before Laurie can voice any thoughts, Annie quickly makes her exit through the door. Laurie closes it behind her, then turns back to see Tommy and Lindsey utterly absorbed in the Horror-thon. Meanwhile, Annie moves with urgency across the backyard, entering the garage to find her car, only to be thwarted when she tries the door and discovers it locked. Undeterred, she pivots and leaves the garage behind. Wandering through the silent, empty house, she searches for her purse, eventually spotting it in the front room. She retrieves a brush and lipstick from inside, then positions herself in front of the mirror, taking a moment to primp and adjust her appearance, glancing up at her reflection. Simultaneously, back at the Doyle house, Tommy hides with mischievous intent, planning to surprise Lindsey. As Lindsey rises from the couch and begins to look for Tommy, she pauses, her eyes catching sight of a MAN through the window, ominously carrying what appears to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard, triggering a wave of panic. With a sudden jolt, Tommy leaps from behind the curtain, causing Lindsey to let out a scream and burst into tears. Laurie swiftly enters from the kitchen, finding both children distressed and tearful. Tommy points out the window, prompting Laurie to bend down, offering comfort to Lindsey. Tommy then turns his back on Laurie and Lindsey, retreats to the couch before the TV, and almost immediately, Lindsey ceases her crying, following Tommy and snugly settling beside him, wrapping her arms around him for reassurance. Laurie, observing their quick recovery, shakes her head with a sigh, and makes her way back into the kitchen. Concurrently, the silhouette of the old Myers house looms menacingly against the backdrop of dark, whishing trees. The camera trails behind a hedge, revealing Loomis, who sits with a watchful eye waiting in anticipation. Abruptly, the silence is broken by noises from the street, revealing three boys—Keith, Richie, and Lonnie—who tentatively approach the edge of the sidewalk, nervously eyeing the forbidding, tomb-like structure of the old house. Loomis parts the hedge before him, peering intently at the scene unfolding. For a brief moment, Lonnie hesitates, then cautiously makes his way through the front gate, moving toward the porch, as Loomis watches the young boy's approach, uncertain about whether to remain a passive observer or to intervene.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Annie waits for a moment while Lindsey is engrossed in the TV Horror-thon, and then they leave the Wallace house. Lindsey carries a bowl of popcorn while Annie has a coat over her negligee. As they walk to the Doyles through the wind, the SHAPE observes them from a streetlight. Tommy opens the door for them, and Lindsey quickly joins the TV, shedding her coat and devouring her popcorn. As Laurie notices their arrival, Annie hurries out, leaving Laurie watching the children. Annie crosses to the garage and checks her car door before searching the house for her purse, primping in front of the mirror once she finds it. Meanwhile, Tommy hides to scare Lindsey, who searches for him until Tommy's scream frightens her. Laurie comforts the crying children, and they soon return to the couch, where Lindsey hugs Tommy. Laurie returns to the kitchen. Outside, the Myers house looms ominously. Loomis waits behind a hedge as Keith, Richie, and Lonnie hesitantly approach the old house, with Lonnie venturing toward the porch while Loomis contemplates intervening.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Annie, known for her knack with numbers from working at the local bank, calculates a moment while Lindsey is back watching the TV Horror-thon, a Halloween tradition in town featuring classic horror films, and her eyes light up. Annie and Lindsey come out of the Wallace house, a typical suburban home known for its well-kept garden, with Lindsey carrying a bowl of popcorn and Annie having a coat over her negligee. As they walk down the street to the Doyles, famous in the neighborhood for hosting the best Halloween parties, the wind blowing strong and whipping the negligee around Annie's legs as they make their way down the street, The SHAPE, a mysterious figure whose presence has been whispered about among the townsfolk, steps into the glow of the streetlight and watches them. Tommy, eager to see his friends, runs to answer it and opens the door, where Annie and Lindsey stand. Lindsey sees the TV and runs into the living room, which is decorated with spooky cobwebs for Halloween, taking off her coat, sitting in front of the TV, and eating her popcorn. She glances at Annie's coat, a stylish hand-me-down from her older sister, as Laurie glances at Lindsey. Before Laurie, who is known for her babysitting prowess, can say anything else, Annie rushes out the door. Laurie closes the door and looks in at Tommy and Lindsey engrossed in the Horror-thon. Annie hurries across the backyard and steps into the garage, a place filled with old tools and gardening supplies, walks to her car, tries the door, then quickly turns and walks out of the garage. Annie wanders through the empty house, which echoes with creaking floors, looking for her purse, finds it in the front room, takes out her brush and lipstick, and stands in front of the mirror primping, a habit she picked up from her mother. She glances up at her image in the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy hides, preparing to jump out and scare Lindsey as their parents warned them not to. Lindsey gets up from the couch to search for Tommy and turns around looking for him. For a moment, he glances out the window and sees the figure of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard, sparking fear that matches the horror movie they were watching. Tommy SCREAMS and jumps out from the curtain, scaring Lindsey, who also SCREAMS and begins crying. Laurie rushes in from the kitchen, finding the children in tears. Tommy points out the window, and Laurie bends down to comfort her. Tommy turns away from Laurie and Lindsey and walks over to the couch in front of the TV set, and almost instantly, Lindsey stops crying and follows him, sitting up next to Tommy and hugging him. Laurie shakes her head, recalling her own childhood fears, and walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile, the old Myers house, long abandoned after a grim family incident years ago, looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark, whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the hedge where Loomis, a dedicated psychiatrist who has been tracking The SHAPE, sits waiting. Suddenly, there are noises from the street, and three boys, Keith, Richie, and Lonnie, known for their daring antics, creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house, staring fearfully at the dark, tomb-like structure. Loomis parts the hedge in front of him and stares. For a moment, Lonnie hesitates, then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch, while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house, uncertain whether he should interfere or just watch and gather more information on The SHAPE's movements.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Meanwhile Tommy hides preparing to jump out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey gets up from the couch to search for Tommy and turns around looking for him. For a moment he glances out the window and sees the figure of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard. Tommy SCREAMS and jumps out from the curtain scaring Lindsey who also SCREAMS and begins crying. Laurie rushes in from the kitchen finding the children in tears. Tommy points out the window and Laurie bends down to comfort her. Tommy turns away from Laurie and Lindsey and walks over to the couch in front of the TV set and almost instantly Lindsey stops crying and follows him sitting up next to Tommy and hugging him. Laurie shakes her head and walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile the old Myers house looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the hedge where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly there are noises from the street and three boys Keith Richie and Lonnie creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house staring fearfully at the dark tomblike structure. Loomis parts the hedge in front of him and stares. For a moment Lonnie hesitates then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch. while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house unsure whether he should interfere or just watch.

In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Meanwhile Tommy hides preparing to jump out and scare Lindsey. Lindsey gets up from the couch to search for Tommy and turns around looking for him. For a moment he glances out the window and sees the figure of a MAN carrying what seems to be a BODY across the Wallace's backyard. Tommy SCREAMS and jumps out from the curtain scaring Lindsey who also SCREAMS and begins crying. Laurie rushes in from the kitchen finding the children in tears. Tommy points out the window and Laurie bends down to comfort her. Tommy turns away from Laurie and Lindsey and walks over to the couch in front of the TV set and almost instantly Lindsey stops crying and follows him sitting up next to Tommy and hugging him. Laurie shakes her head and walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile the old Myers house looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the hedge where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly there are noises from the street and three boys Keith Richie and Lonnie creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house staring fearfully at the dark tomblike structure. Loomis parts the hedge in front of him and stares. For a moment Lonnie hesitates then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch. while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house unsure whether he should interfere or just watch.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Annie calculates a moment while Lindsey is back watching the TV Horrorthon and her eyes light up. Annie and Lindsey come out of the Wallace house with Lindsey carrying a bowl of popcorn and Annie having a coat over her negligee. They walk down the street to the Doyles. the wind blowing strong and whipping the negligee around Annie's legs as they make their way down the street. The SHAPE steps into the glow of the streetlight and watches them. Tommy runs to answer it and opens the door where Annie and Lindsey stand. Lindsey sees the TV and runs into the living room taking off her coat sitting in front of the TV and eating her popcorn. Laurie shakes her head and walks back into the kitchen. Meanwhile the old Myers house looks ominous and foreboding silhouetted against the dark whishing trees. The camera tracks behind the hedge where Loomis sits waiting. Suddenly there are noises from the street and three boys Keith Richie and Lonnie creep up to the edge of the sidewalk in front of the old house staring fearfully at the dark tomblike structure. Loomis parts the hedge in front of him and stares. For a moment Lonnie hesitates then slowly moves through the front gate up toward the porch. while Loomis watches the young boy walk toward the house unsure whether he should interfere or just watch.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Bert balances a puzzle while Carla is gone stacking the chairs in the attic and her eyebrows arch. Bert and Carla emerge from the Jackson apartment, with Carla lugging a basket of apples and Bert sporting a hat over his pajamas. They skip down the avenue to the Millers, the breeze gusting mighty and lifting the pajamas around Bert's ankles as they proceed down the avenue. The SILHOUETTE steps into the aura of the spotlight and observes them. Jesse dashes to greet it and swings open the gate, where Bert and Carla stand. Carla spots the painting and darts into the dining room, shedding her jacket, plopping in front of the easel, and munching her apple. She peers at Bert's jacket as Mark peeks at Carla. Before Mark can utter anything else, Bert dashes out the gate. Mark shuts the gate and peers in at Jesse and Carla absorbed in the attic. Bert races across the field and steps into the shed, strolls to his bike, tries the handle, then swiftly pivots and exits the shed. Bert ambles through the vacant apartment searching for his keys, finds them in the den, extracts his comb and journal, and stands before the window preening. He peers up at his reflection in the window. Meanwhile, Jesse crouches, ready to leap out and jolt Carla. Carla rises from the armchair to hunt for Jesse and spins around scanning for him. Briefly, he peers out the doorway and observes the outline of a WOMAN hauling what appears to be a CRATE across the Jackson's field. Jesse YELLS and leaps out from the drapery, startling Carla, who also YELLS and starts sobbing. Mark rushes in from the basement, discovering the youngsters in distress. Jesse gestures toward the doorway, and Mark bends down to console her. Jesse turns his back on Mark and Carla and strides over to the armchair in front of the easel, and almost immediately, Carla ceases sobbing and trails him, sitting up beside Jesse and embracing him. Mark sighs and retreats to the basement. Meanwhile, the old Sanders mansion appears threatening and menacing silhouetted against the dim, fluttering flags. The camera trails behind the shrub where Lucas perches waiting. Abruptly, there are echoes from the boulevard, and three youths, Owen, Harry, and Benny, tiptoe to the verge of the driveway in front of the old mansion, gazing nervously at the shadowy, mausoleum-like edifice. Lucas parts the shrub before him and gazes. Momentarily, Benny pauses, then gradually advances through the front portal up toward the porch, while Lucas observes the young youth amble toward the mansion, uncertain whether he should intrude or merely observe.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Annie seizes a moment while Lindsey watches TV, and they leave the Wallace house, Lindsey with popcorn and Annie in a coat over her negligee. As they walk to the Doyles, the SHAPE watches them from the street. At the Doyles, Lindsey rushes to the TV with her popcorn. Annie quickly departs, searching for her purse in the house, and primps in front of the mirror. Meanwhile, Tommy hides to scare Lindsey, and when he does, they both scream after seeing a figure carrying what looks like a body. Laurie comforts them, and soon they return to watching TV together. The ominous Myers house stands against the night, where Loomis waits, watching three boys who approach the house fearfully. Lonnie ventures toward the porch as Loomis debates whether to intervene.
